item.title: Js Reference
item.description: ES6 Things The Spread Operator const updatedArray = [...previousState, newElement]; The Optional Operator // Deeply nested fields got ya down? const value = deeply.

item.title: Js Cheatsheet
item.description: Creating Characther Map // List of everything /** * CHARACHTER MAP * * Creating a char map */ const createCharMap = (string) => { const map = {}; for (let item of string) { if (map[item]) { map[item]++; } else { map[item] = 1; } } return map; }; // fast char map const createCharMap = (string) => { const map = {}; for (let item of string) { map[item] = map[item] + 1 || 1; } return map; }; // or another way Array Helpers /** * LENGTH OF OBJECT */ const someObject = {}; Object.

item.title: Basic Js
item.description: Topics to Learn ES6 ES6, or ES6 compatible, javascript is considered modern javascript. ES6 is a specification of JavaScipt that defines the syntax that is considered valid javascript.
